div.text:p: There are a number of interesting challenges here:

text:list-item.text:p: How to make a customised export based on styles in Writer.
This is specific to Writer, and at this stage of the game it's a moving target.
How to map styles to nicely nested XHTML.
This is a perennial topic; while there are word processors with their own idea about structure, which is largely flat.

body.p: There are a number of interesting challenges here:

li.p: How to make a customised export based on styles in Writer.
This is specific to Writer, and at this stage of the game it's a moving target.
How to map styles to nicely nested XHTML.
This is a perennial topic; while there are word processors with their own idea about structure, which is largely flat.

test.name: List with in li1n for item inside li1n

text:list-item.text:p:
Outstanding debtors at the end of November would represent the credit sales made during the months of October and November ($250 000 each month). It would also have been possible to prepare a debtors budget as illustrated below.
Debtors budget

text:list-header.text:p:
* As stated in the question.
**
Based on debtors taking two months' credit; e.g. April's sales are received in June, May's sales are received in July, etc.

text:list-item.text:p: The closing balance of inventory at the end of November was stated in the question.

Calculated as $190 000 (balance at the end of May) plus the $200 000 acquisition. Depreciation on the non current assets has been ignored as sufficient details have not been provided to allow it to be calculated.

li.p:
Outstanding debtors at the end of November would represent the credit sales made during the months of October and November ($250 000 each month). It would also have been possible to prepare a debtors budget as illustrated below.
Debtors budget

* As stated in the question.
** Based on debtors taking two months' credit; e.g. April's sales are received in June, May's sales are received in July, etc.
The closing balance of inventory at the end of November was stated in the question.

Calculated as $190 000 (balance at the end of May) plus the $200 000 acquisition. Depreciation on the non current assets has been ignored as sufficient details have not been provided to allow it to be calculated.
